channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Senators Seek to Curb Facial Recognition at Airports, Citing Privacy Concerns
item.description: A bipartisan group of lawmakers is pushing to add language to the reauthorization of the Federal Aviation Administration that would halt expansion of the technology.

item.title: Live Updates: Negotiators Arrive in Cairo as Israel Seizes Rafah Crossing
item.description: Hamas and Israeli officials traveled to Egypt to restart cease-fire talks, hours after the Israeli military sent tanks into southern Gaza in what it called a limited operation.

item.title: Billionaire Stan Druckenmiller says he'd give Bidenomics an ‘F’ because inflation almost came down before the Fed 'fumbled on the five-yard line’
item.description: The famed investor accused the Federal Reserve and the Biden administration of misdiagnosing the severity of the pandemic’s economic crisis.

item.title: Biden Condemns a ‘Ferocious Surge’ of Antisemitism in the United States
item.description: President Biden’s speech at a Holocaust remembrance ceremony came during weeks of protests on U.S. college campuses against Israel’s war in Gaza.

item.title: Boy Scouts to Change Its Name to Scouting America
item.description: The organization, which is battling bankruptcy and sexual abuse claims, said the rebrand was part of an effort to be more inclusive and welcome all members of America’s youth.

item.title: Boeing is such a mess it plans to 'celebrate' its latest whistleblower—even though two just suddenly died
item.description: “It’s critical that every one of us speak up,” Boeing VP Scott Stocker told employees in a memo.

item.title: U.S. Tightens Rules on Risky Virus Research
item.description: A long-awaited new policy broadens the type of regulated viruses, bacteria, fungi and toxins, including those that could threaten crops and livestock.

item.title: Blinken Holds Regional Talks on Migration in Latin America
item.description: Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken’s trip to Guatemala comes as the United States tries to get countries in the region to ramp up enforcement of their borders.

item.title: Job seekers—you shouldn't balk when a test is part of your interview
item.description: Employers look for “can do” attitudes exemplifying grit, ambition, and problem-solving—not the opposite.

item.title: TikTok Sues US Government Over Potential Ban
item.description: The social media company and its Chinese parent, ByteDance, sued to challenge the new law, saying it violated users’ First Amendment rights.

item.title: U.S. Repatriates 11 American Citizens From ISIS War Camps in Syria
item.description: The group — the largest set of Americans retrieved from the war zone — was joined by a 9-year-old noncitizen whose brother is an American.

item.title: 200-page report offers ‘sobering look’ inside toxic workplace at the government agency that regulates bankers, sources say
item.description: The investigation was prompted by a Wall Street Journal article that reported female bank examiners had left the FDIC because of its “sexualized, boys’ club environment.”

item.title: Macron Hosts Xi Jinping, China’s President, in the French Pyrenees
item.description: The French president took Xi Jinping to his childhood haunts high in the Pyrenees, hoping to forge a bond. If only the weather would have cooperated.

item.title: Two Dozen Bodies Brought to Rafah Hospital, Doctor Says
item.description: The head of Kuwait Hospital in Rafah said the situation at the facility amid the Israeli military incursion was “catastrophic in every sense of the word.”

item.title: Former Yahoo CEO Marissa Mayer was Google’s first female engineer—only because she tried to delete a recruiter email and accidentally opened it instead
item.description: Mayer's career can be boiled down to a single wrong keystroke.
